title: Coronavirus: How Italy has fought back from virus disaster
description: Italy was the first country in Europe to be overwhelmed by the virus but is so far keeping it in check.

title: US Election: Whoever becomes the next president, social media is changing
description: Both Trump and Biden want to take away the US law that protects platforms from being liable for what their users post.

title: Coronavirus: Dorset festival artwork tribute to victims
description: In Memoriam has been created out of bed sheets and was installed on the beach at Sandbanks.

title: Onions, ironing and 'sex appeal': Who is Tony Abbott?
description: The gaffe-prone former prime minister is a polarising figure in Australia.

title: 'I worked a five-hour shift and got paid nothing'
description: A 19-year-old woman begins a campaign to ban unpaid work trials after working a shift for no pay.

title: Palantir: The controversial data firm now worth £17bn
description: The rise of the US tech company has been shadowed by concerns about privacy and surveillance.

title: 'It's OK to have a bad day': The challenge of motherhood during the pandemic
description: Three mothers talk about life in a pandemic, and the 'total chaos' of working from home with kids.

title: Sonic boom heard across Paris
description: People in the French capital are interrupted by a loud bang as a plane travels at supersonic speed.

title: Biodiversity: Why the nature crisis matters, in five graphics
description: Human destruction of nature has led to the extinction of many plants and animals.

title: Harry Potter book used to teach English valued at £30k
description: The book belongs to a British expat who posted it to auctioneers wrapped in a tea towel.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson defends local lockdown strategy
description: Labour asks how people can be expected to understand and follow rules if the PM himself does not.

title: Coronavirus: Ministers treating Parliament with 'contempt,' says Speaker Hoyle
description: The PM is spared a Commons revolt in a vote later - but is warned not to treat Parliament "with contempt".

title: National League clubs to get emergency grant
description: National League clubs have been told they will receive an emergency grant to enable them to start the new season this weekend.

title: Presidential debate: Trump and Biden trade insults in chaotic debate
description: The rivals spar over the pandemic, race and even their families in a debate disrupted by shouting.

title: Bairstow loses England Test central contract
description: Wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow is not offered an England central contract for Test cricket, though he retains a limited-overs deal.

title: Covid-19: Coventry University student flats partygoers flout rules
description: Coventry University says the "blatant breaches of the rule of six" risk the health of students.

title: County lines: Teenage drug dealers posed as key workers during lockdown
description: Gang leaders urged dealers to vary working hours to be less obvious in lockdown, a report reveals.

title: Ascension Island: Priti Patel considered outpost for UK asylum centre location
description: The idea of "offshoring" people claiming asylum is dependent on a suitable location, a source said.

title: Banaz Mahmod murder: 'What they did was unforgivable'
description: Banaz Mahmod was murdered by her uncle and father, fourteen years on her sister has chosen to speak out for the first time.

title: Berlin patient: First person cured of HIV, Timothy Ray Brown, dies
description: Mr Brown, known as the Berlin patient, was cured after a bone marrow transplant to treat leukaemia.

title: Aaron Donald, D.K. Metcalf & Kalen Ballage in best bits of the NFL you may have missed
description: BBC Sport's Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell take us through some of the best bits of the NFL you may have missed including an attempt at showboating which goes wrong for Seattle's D.K.Metcalf.

title: French Open 2020: Serena Williams withdraws from competition on day four
description: Three-time French Open champion Serena Williams withdraws from the 2020 event because of injury.

title: Aston Villa sign Barkley from Chelsea on season-long loan
description: Aston Villa sign England midfielder Ross Barkley from Chelsea on a season-long loan.

title: Brexit: Blow to UK car industry in search for EU deal
description: Documents seen by the BBC suggest key priorities for the car sector have been rebuffed by Brussels.

title: TSB to close a third of branches and cut 900 jobs
description: The bank will shut 164 branches, adding to the 82 earmarked for closure in November.

title: Presidential debate: Trump and Biden's claims fact-checked
description: The first of three presidential debates centred on the pandemic, race and the economy.

title: Maritime life around the coast of Britain
description: The winning pictures from this year's Shipwrecked Mariners' Society photography competition.

title: US Election 2020: Who are the Proud Boys - and who are antifa?
description: A guide to the fringe movements that became a debate flash point.

title: Presidential debate: 'The loser is us, the American people'
description: Voters from across the US weigh in with reaction to the first Trump-Biden debate.

title: Leicester City's Alves shows off his fast feet in Wonderkids
description: In the third episode of our Wonderkids challenge, 15-year-old Leicester City academy star Will Alves shows off his fast feet and freestyle moves in three skill-based challenges.

title: Watch the key exchanges of the debate
description: Donald Trump and Joe Biden didn't hold back in an angry presidential debate that got personal and ugly.

title: UK beef exports to US resume after more than 20 years
description: The US banned British beef exports in the wake of the Mad Cow Disease scandal in the 1990s.

title: First Trump-Biden presidential debate: Trump clashes with moderator
description: President Donald Trump clashes with moderator Chris Wallace.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Trying out tech that may help make worship Covid-secure
description: Dr John Wright looks at the kit installed in a Bradford mosque in the hope of limiting the spread of Covid-19.
